block.p: Bob Chase, president of the National Education Association
John Sweeney, president of the American Federation of Labor and Congress of Industrial Organizations
Representative Dick Gephardt of Missouri, the House minority leader
Address by the vice presidential nominee, Senator Joseph I. Lieberman
Roll Call on the nomination of Al Gore for president
10 p.m. to 11 p.m. -- live coverage of nominating process
CNN 7 p.m. to 11 p.m. -- live coverage 11 p.m. to midnight -- convention wrap-up
FOX (Channel 5 in New York) No special coverage
FOX NEWS CHANNEL 6 p.m. to 1 a.m. -- live coverage
MSNBC 5 p.m. to 1 a.m. -- live coverage
NBC (Channel 4 in New York) 10 p.m. to 11 p.m. live coverage with Tom Brokaw and Tim Russert
NY1 NEWS 7 p.m. to 8 p.m. -- special edition of ''Inside City Hall'' 11 p.m. to 11:30 p.m. -- convention wrap-up
PBS (Channel 13 in New York) 8 p.m. to past 11 p.m. -- live coverage Other networks
COMEDY CENTRAL 11 p.m. to 11:30 p.m. -- ''Daily Show With Jon Stewart''
www.dems2000.com www.algore2000.com www.democrats.org www.dscc.org www.dccc.org www.democraticgovernors.org

Many major news organizations are planning to use live video from the television pool coverage by C-Span on their Web sites that will be the same as that broadcast by the television networks. Other Web-based news sites will provide similar coverage and NationalJournal.com, which is normally open only to subscribers, will have open access during the conventions and provide a guide to convention news on the Web.
In addition, America Online will offer video from the convention hall 24 hours a day, while ''Choose or Lose'' on mtv.com will offer the latest video from MTV News.
''Political Points,'' a live Webcast produced jointly by The New York Times and ABC News, can be viewed daily at 1:30 p.m. and 8 p.m. Eastern time at: www.nytimes.com/politicsabcnews.go.com

Additional coverage is available at both sites, including past Webcasts and, via C-Span, live gavel-to-gavel floor proceedings. In addition, Yahoo will offer a daily Webcast at 2:20 p.m. featuring columnists from The New York Times and members of its editorial board.
